text.*:
See also: List of countries by style of national flags and Commons:Gallery of flags by design

This is a list of flags, arranged by design, serving as a navigational aid for identifying a given flag.

Contents

  • 1 Solid
    • 1.1 Charged
  • 2 Bicolour
  • 3 Tricolour and other tribands
  • 4 Quartered
  • 5 Stripes
  • 6 Border
  • 7 Canton
  • 8 Shape
    • 8.1 Circle or sphere
    • 8.2 Crescent
    • 8.3 Cross
    • 8.4 Diamond
    • 8.5 Spiral
    • 8.6 Square
    • 8.7 Star
    • 8.8 Sun
    • 8.9 Triangle
  • 9 Living organism
    • 9.1 Animal
    • 9.2 Person or Body Part

  • 10 Object
    • 10.1 Anchor, Boat, or Ship

Solid[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of solid flags.

Examples:

Flag of Libya (1977–2011)
Olympic Flag
White flag of truce, peace, or surrender

Charged[edit]

Flag of China
(red flag charged with yellow canton stars in the top left corner, colors reminiscent of the Flag of the Qing dynasty and the Flag of the Republic of China)
Flag of Japan
(white flag charged with a centered red circular disc representing the sun, embodying the name Land of the Rising Sun)
Flag of New Mexico
(yellow flag charged with a centered red Zia Pueblo sun symbol, colors of the Flag of Spain representing Hispano Nuevo México)
Flag of Rapa Nui
(white flag charged with a centered red Rei Miru, an ornamental Easter Island wearable wood carving)

Bicolour[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Bicolor flags.

Examples:

Flag of Rome (vertical bicolour)
Flag of Malta (charged vertical bicolour)
Flag of Portugal (charged vertical bicolour)
Flag of Algeria (charged vertical bicolour)
Vatican City (charged vertical bicolour)
Flag of Indonesia (horizontal bicolour)
Flag of Ukraine (horizontal bicolour)
Flag of Tatarstan (fimbriated horizontal bicolour)
Flag of Haiti (charged horizontal bicolour)
Flag of Angola (charged horizontal bicolour)
Flag of Bhutan (charged diagonal bicolour)
Flag of Galicia (bicolour with a diagonal stripe)
Flag of Trinidad and Tobago (charged fimbriated diagonal bicolour)
Flag of Finland (cross bicolour)
Flag of Bahrain (serrated vertical bicolour)

Tricolour and other tribands[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of triband flags.

Examples:

Flag of India (charged Horizontal tricolour triband)
Flag of France (vertical tricolour triband)
Flag of Italy (vertical tricolour triband)
Flag of Romania (vertical tricolour triband)
Flag of Mexico (charged vertical tricolour triband)
Flag of the Netherlands (horizontal tricolour triband)
Flag of Germany (horizontal tricolour triband)
Flag of Russia (horizontal tricolour triband)
Flag of Serbia (charged horizontal tricolour triband)
Flag of Hungary (horizontal tricolour triband)
Flag of Canada (charged vertical bicolour triband)
Flag of Austria (horizontal bicolour triband)
Flag of Ecuador (charged horizontal tricolour)
Flag of The Gambia (fimbriated horizontal tricolour)
Flag of Namibia (charged fimbriated diagonal tricolour)
Flag of Benin (tribar)
Flag of Madagascar (tribar)
Flag of the United Arab Emirates (polybar)
Flag of Oman (polybar)
Flag of Nigeria (vertical bicolour triband)
Flag of Sealand (diagonal tricolour)

Quartered[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of quartered flags.

Examples:

Flag of Maryland, United States (orthogonal)
Flag of Panama (orthogonal)
Flag of Burundi (diagonal)
Flag of Jamaica (diagonal)
Flag of Ceuta, Spain (gyronny)

Stripes[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of striped flags.

Examples:

NATO signal flag turn (vertical stripes)
Flag of Catalonia, Spain (horizontal stripes)
Flag of South Africa (pall)
Flag of Vanuatu (pall)
Flag of the Republic of Macedonia (ray)
Naval Jack of the Netherlands (ray)

Border[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of bordered flags.

Examples:

Flag of Grenada
Flag of Guam
Flag of Montenegro
Flag of the Maldives
Flag of the Kingdom of the Two Sicilies
Flag of Wyoming, United States

Canton[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with cantons.

Examples:

Flag of Bermuda
Flag of Chile
Flag of Fiji
Flag of Malaysia
Flag of Saint Helena
Flag of the United States
British Red Ensign (see also: Flags based on British ensigns on Wikimedia Commons)
Esperanto flag

Shape[edit]

Circle or sphere[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with circles.

Examples:

Earth flag
Flag of Europe
Flag of Japan
Flag of Bangladesh
Flag of Palau
Flag of the Vietnamese National Party

Crescent[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with crescents.

Examples:

Flag of Turkey (crescent facing single star)
Flag of Azerbaijan (crescent facing single star)
Flag of Malaysia (crescent facing a 14-point star)
Flag of Turkmenistan (crescent facing constellation)
Flag of Nepal (crescent and sun)
Flag of Singapore (crescent and five stars)

Cross[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Flags with crosses.

Examples:

Flag of Saint David (symmetric cross)
Flag of Denmark (Nordic cross)
Flag of Sardinia (Saint George's Cross and Four Moors heads)
Flag of Scotland (Saltire / St. Andrew's Cross)
Flag of the Dominican Republic
Flag of Occitania (Occitan cross and Felibritge star)

Diamond[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with diamonds.

Examples:

Flag of Amapá
Flag of Arkansas
Flag of Brazil
Flag of the Republic of the Rif
Flag of Yokohama, Japan

Spiral[edit]

Examples:

Flag of Tino rangatiratanga movement
Flag of Ottawa
Flag of Ibaraki Prefecture

Square[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Square flags.

Examples:

Flag of Switzerland (square flag)
Wiphala, https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiphala (square flag)
ICS flag sierra (square in flag)
Flag of the Northwest Territories, Canada (Canadian pale)
The checkered flag
Flag of Croatia (checkerboard in seal)

Star[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with stars.

Examples:

Flag of Israel (blue 6-pointed star - Star of David)
Assyrian flag
Flag of Brazil
Flag of Chile
Flag of the People's Republic of China
Flag of Comoros
Flag of Dominica
Flag of Cabo Verde
Flag of Morocco (pentagram)
Flag of the Community of Madrid (white 5-pointed stars)
Flag of Chicago
Flag of the Red Army of the Soviet Union (fimbriated red 5-pointed star)
Flag of Portland, Oregon (white 4-pointed star)
Flag of Texas(white 5-pointed star)
Flag of the United States
Flag of Ghana
Flag of Venezuela (8 arched 5 pointed stars)
Flag of Democratic Republic of the Congo
Flag of Vietnam
Flag of Somalia

Sun[edit]

Flag of Japan
Flag of Kyrgyzstan
Flag of New Mexico
Flag of Taiwan

Triangle[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with triangles.

Examples:

Flag of Minas Gerais, Brazil
Flag of the Czech Republic
Flag of Djibouti
Flag of Guyana
Flag of South Sudan
Flag of Salinas, Puerto Rico
Flag of Bosnia and Herzegovina
Flag of Saint Lucia

Living organism[edit]

Animal[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Flags with animals.

Examples:

Flag of California, United States (grizzly bear)
Flag of Berlin, Germany (bear)
Flag of Albania (double-headed eagle)
Flag of Saurashtra (horse)
Flag of Papua New Guinea (bird-of-paradise)
Flag of Flanders, Belgium (lion)
Flag of Sri Lanka (lion)
Flag of Bhutan (dragon)
Flag of Wales (dragon)
Flag of Zimbabwe (Zimbabwe Bird)

Person or Body Part[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Flags with humans.

Examples:

Flag of Sardinia (Four Moors heads and Saint George's Cross)
Flag of Corsica (Moor's head)
Flag of the Isle of Man (leg)
Flag of Sicily (leg and head)
Flag of New Jersey (Liberty and Ceres)
Flag of Ulster (hand)
Flag of Benin Empire (people)

Plant[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with plants.

Examples:

Flag of Quebec (fleur-de-lis)
Flag of Kalmykia (lotus)
Flag of the United Nations (olive branches)
Flag of Lebanon (cedar)
Flag of Hong Kong (Bauhinia blakeana)

Object[edit]

Anchor, Boat, or Ship[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of nautical flags.

Examples:

Flag of Anchorage, Alaska (an anchor)
Flag of New Brunswick (a galley)
Flag of Quebec City (the Don de Dieu)
Flag of Saint Pierre and Miquelon (the Grande Hermine)

Astronomical object[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with stars.

Examples:

Flag of Argentina (Sun of May)
Flag of Australia (Crux)
Flag of Brazil (several constellations)
Flag of Laos (Moon)
Flag of Palau (Moon)
Flag of the Republic of Macedonia (Sun)
Flag of New Zealand (Crux)
Flag of the Philippines (Sun)

Book[edit]

Flag of the Dominican Republic
Flag of Mozambique

Building[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Flags with buildings.

Examples:

Flag of Afghanistan (a mosque)
Flag of Cambodia (Angkor Wat)
Flag of Durban, South Africa (City Hall dome)
Flag of the Isle of Wight, UK (Carisbrooke Castle)
Flag of Toronto, Canada (Toronto City Hall)
Royal Standard of the Duke of Edinburgh (Castle)

Headgear[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with headgear.

Examples:

State Ensign of Belgium (crown)
State Flag of Hungary (Crown of Saint Stephen)
Flag of Calgary, Alberta (Smithbilt)
Flag of the Vatican City (Papal Tiara)
Personal Flag of Queen Elizabeth II (crown)
Flag of the Governor of Southern Rhodesia (1951-1970) (crown)

Flag[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Flags with flags.
Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with cantons.

Examples:

South African Prinsevlag (1928–1994) (flags of the United Kingdom, Orange Free State, and Transvaal)
Flag of Georgia, USA (2001–2003) (1777 U.S. flag, traditional, 1920, and 1956 Georgia flags, and current U.S. flag)
Flag of Haiti (six vertically hoisted Haitian flags)
Flag of Saint Pierre and Miquelon, France (Basque, Breton, and Norman flags)
Flag of Tuvalu (Union Jack in canton)

Hill, Mountain, or Rock[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Geographical flags.

Examples:

Flag of Roswell, New Mexico (El Capitan)
Flag of Shizuoka Prefecture (Mount Fuji)
Flag of Sint Eustatius (The Quill)
Flag of Slovakia (Tatra, Mátra and Fatra)

Map[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Geographical flags.

Examples:

Flag of Bangladesh (1971)
Flag of Cyprus
Flag of Kosovo
Flag of Unified Korea

Machine, Tool, or Instrument[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Flags with devices.

Examples:

Flag of Angola (machete and cog wheel)
Flag of Kaluga, Russia
(satellite)
Flag of Portugal
(armillary sphere)
Presidential Standard of Ireland (harp)
Flag of the Canton of Geneva, Switzerland (key)
Flag of the Soviet Union (hammer and sickle)

Shield or Weapon[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Gallery of flags with weapons.

Examples:

Flag of Saudi Arabia (Sword)
Flag of Essex, England (seax)
Flag of the Brazilian Empire (Shield)
Flag of Guatemala (rifle)
Flag of Kenya (shield and spears)
Flag of Mozambique (AK-47)
Flag of Swaziland (shield and spears)
Flag of the United States Virgin Islands (arrows)
Flag of Barbados (Trident)

Inscription[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Inscribed flags.

Examples:

Flag of Rwanda (1962-2001) (Latin)
Flag of Venda (1973-1994) (Latin)
Flag of Dutch East India Company, (Latin)
Flag of Russian SFSR (1918-1920) (Cyrillic)
Flag of Magway Division, Myanmar (Burmese)
Flag of Saudi Arabia (Arabic)
Flag of Iran (Arabic)
Flag of Righteous Army, Japan (Kanji)
Flag of Lanfang Republic (1777-1884) (Chinese)
